primary_diagnosis.description: Major depressive disorder, recurrent, moderate episode
primary_diagnosis.justification: Clinical history confirms recurrent episodes of depression without mania/hypomania. The patient is currently experiencing an active episode, evidenced by the recent initiation of *Sertraline* (4 weeks ago), which warrants a moderate severity specifier due to ongoing, impactful symptoms.
dsm_criteria_met: Meets criteria for a Major Depressive Episode (MDE).
History confirms at least one prior MDE.
No history of manic or hypomanic episodes (ruling out Bipolar I/II).
Current symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment.

ruled_out.reason: Clinical Entity Agent confirms history suggests 'Recurrent' MDD.
Patient explicitly denied any history of manic or hypomanic episodes.

ruled_out.description: Major depressive disorder, recurrent, in full remission
ruled_out.reason: Symptoms are active, warranting treatment start 4 weeks ago (*Sertraline*), indicating a current moderate episode, not remission.
